intro: Galium maritimum subsp. luteum, commonly known as sea bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to coastal regions of the Mediterranean. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils along shorelines, exhibiting a low, sprawling growth habit. The plant features slender, branched stems that are often covered in fine hairs, and its leaves are opposite, ovate, and usually hairy. Its flowers are small, yellowish, and clustered in umbels, blooming from late spring to early summer. This subspecies is adapted to salt spray and well-drained conditions, making it a characteristic component of coastal flora.
